div.p: Select ERM work based on wich standard, ISO 31000 or COSO ERM:

ISO 31000, the international standard for risk management, provides a framework for identifying, assessing, and managing risks. While ISO 31000 does not specify exact categories of risk, it outlines principles and a process that can be used to classify risks into categories relevant to the organization or context.

The COSO ERM Framework (Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission's Enterprise Risk Management Framework) provides a structured approach for managing risks within an organization. It categorizes risks to ensure a holistic view of risk management. Like ISO 31000, COSO ERM doesn't prescribe specific risk categories but suggests categories commonly used in practice, aligned with organizational objectives.
